kpi_info.title: period_duration
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: HLR_USEDSPACE
kpi_info.use: The filling rate of the HLR databaseis calculated as the average of the operative HLRU pairs. For each HLRU, the essential file with the highest filling rate is included in the calculation.The essential files are the ones that contain the basic data on the subscriber and the basic and supplementary services of the subscriber. Two link files are also included. These link files are used for the connections between the subscriber data and the data on the basic and supplementary services of the subscriber.

kpi_info.title: HLR_NUMBEROFHLRUS
kpi_info.use: Total number of HLRU pairs in the HLR.

kpi_info.title: HLR_NUMBEROFANSWHLRUS
kpi_info.use: Number of HLRUs which responded to inquiry. This number can be different from the NUMBER OF HLRUS in the case when some of the HLRUs are temporarily out of order or they are overloaded. The field has effect on the rest of the report

kpi_info.title: HLR_MISSINGDATAHLRU0VALUEIS1
kpi_info.use: If a message (data) from some HLRUs ismissing, the identity of the HLRU is shown in the list. It is possible that the NUMBER OF ANSWERED HLRUS equals with the NUMBER OF HLRUs but this field shows some missing data. The field has effect on the rest of the report. (The text appears only in case of missing data. Value can be 1 or 0 due to HLRU no. 0 has missing data.)

kpi_info.title: HLR_MISSINGDATAHLRU1VALUEIS1
kpi_info.use: If a message (data) from some HLRU is missing,the identity of the HLRU is shown in the list. It is possible that the NUMBER OF ANSWERED HLRUS equals with the NUMBER OF HLRUS but this field shows some missing data. The field has effect on the rest of the report. (The text appears only in case of missing data. Value can be 1 or 0 due to HLRU no. 1 has missing data.)

kpi_info.title: PRN_RETRY_ATTEMPT
kpi_info.use: Total number of PRN (provide roaming number) retry attempts Measured object: HLR

kpi_info.title: PRN_RETRY_SUCC
kpi_info.use: Total number of successful PRN (provide roaming number) retries Measured object: HLR

kpi_info.title: HLR_RESTARTINHLRUIFVALUEIS1
kpi_info.use: This field indicates that duplex restart occurred in HLRU(s) during the measurement. The counters are unreliable. The field has effect on all report parts.

kpi_info.title: HLR_RESTARTINSTUIFVALUEIS1
kpi_info.use: This field indicates that duplex restart occurred in STU(s) during the measurement. The counters are unreliable. The field has effect on all report part.

kpi_info.title: HLR_HOMESUBSCRIBERSVISITESUCC
kpi_info.use: Number of successful location updates ofhome subscribers going to other PLMNs during the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: HLR_HOMESUBSCRIBERSRETURNSUCC
kpi_info.use: Number of successful location updates by home subscribers returning from other PLMNs during the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: HLR_HOMENORMALSUBSLUTOTALSUCC
kpi_info.use: Total number of successful location updates by home subscribers during the measurement period. The number does not include location updates within the same VLR.

kpi_info.title: HLR_HOMENORMALSUBSLUTOTALFAIL
kpi_info.use: Total number of failed location updates by home subscribers during the measurement period. The number does not include location updates within the same VLR.

kpi_info.title: HLR_NORMALGPRSLUATTEMPT
kpi_info.use: Number of requested Location Registrations(UpdateLocationForGPRS MAP operation) sent by SGSNs during the measurement period. These events are not included in the former normal LU counters. Only those location registrations are shown here which can be seen in the HLR. (Inter SGSN routing area updates)

kpi_info.title: HLR_NORMALGPRSLUSUCC
kpi_info.use: Number of successful Location Registration (UpdateLocationForGPRS_ACKMAP operation) responses sent to SGSNs during the measurement period. These events are not included in the former normal LU counters. Only those location registrations are shown here which can be seen in the HLR. (Inter SGSN routing area updates)

kpi_info.title: HLR_OCCBSCOUNT
kpi_info.use: Number of OCCBS services provisioned.

kpi_info.title: HLR_OCCBSACTIVATEDBYUSER
kpi_info.use: When subscriber A encounters a NetworkDetermined User Busy (NDUB) destination B, subscriber A requests the CCBS supplementary service. The network will then monitor the wanted destination B for becoming idle.

kpi_info.title: HLR_OCCBSDEACTIVATEDBYUSER
kpi_info.use: After CCBS-Request is running in the HLR,it is possible to deactivate it. CCBS Mobiles support functional supplementary service procedures to deactivate CCBS. With non-CCBS Mobiles deactivation is not possible.

kpi_info.title: HLR_OCCBSDEACTIVATEDBYMML
kpi_info.use: Number of originating CCBS services deactivatedby MML

kpi_info.title: HLR_OCCBSDEACTIVATEDBYSYSTEM
kpi_info.use: Number of originating CCBS services deactivatedby SYSTEM

kpi_info.title: HLR_OCCBSDEACTIVATEDBYRECALL
kpi_info.use: Subscriber A accepts the CCBS recall beforethe CCBS recall timer expires.

kpi_info.title: HLR_OCCBSINQUIRYBYUSER
kpi_info.use: After CCBS-Request is running in the HLR,it is possible to interrogate it. CCBS Mobiles support functional supplementary service procedures to interrogate CCBS. With non-CCBS Mobiles inquiry is not possible.

kpi_info.title: HLR_TCCBSCOUNT
kpi_info.use: Number of TCCBS services provisioned

kpi_info.title: HLR_TCCBSACTIVATEDBYSYSTEM
kpi_info.use: When subscriber A encounters a NetworkDetermined User Busy (NDUB) destination B, system requests the CCBS supplementary service for subscriber B.

kpi_info.title: HLR_TCCBSDEACTIVATEDBYMML
kpi_info.use: Number of terminating CCBS services deactivatedby MML

kpi_info.title: HLR_TCCBSDEACTIVATEDBYSYSTEM
kpi_info.use: Number of terminating CCBS services deactivatedby SYSTEM

kpi_info.title: HLR_TCCBSDEACTIVATEDBYRECALL
kpi_info.use: Subscriber B answers to the generated CCBSrecall before the CCBS recall timer expires.

kpi_info.title: HLR_GPRSSUBSCRIBERCOUNT
kpi_info.use: Number of GPRS subscribers, who have at least one PDP context defined in the HLR.

kpi_info.title: HLR_LCSSUBSCRIBERCOUNT
kpi_info.use: Number of subscribers that have at least onelocation service class provisioned.

kpi_info.title: HLR_CSIACTIVESUBSCRIBERCOUNT
kpi_info.use: Number of subscribers having at least one CAMEL Subscription Information active.

kpi_info.title: HLR_UNKNOWNSRIATTEMPT
kpi_info.use: Number of SRI attempts when there is noprovisioned basic service for the MSISDN (received in SRI) or the database reading has failed (in these cases the Basic Service code is not known). These are always unsuccessful SRI operations. (Note: this counter doesn't covers those SRI attempts when the subscriber is unknown in the HLR database)

kpi_info.title: REQHUNTINGORDERMODIF
kpi_info.use: Number of hunting order modification attemptsfor ringing group. This counter appears only if the sequential alerting feature is available and active.

kpi_info.title: REQHUNTINGORDERMODIFSUCC
kpi_info.use: Number of successful hunting order modificationsfor ringing group. This counter appears only if the sequential alerting feature is available and active.

kpi_info.title: REQHUNTINGORDERINQUIR
kpi_info.use: Number of hunting order inquiry attemptsfor ringing group. This counter appears only if the sequential alerting feature is available and active.

kpi_info.title: REQHUNTINGORDERINQUIRSUCC
kpi_info.use: Number of successful hunting order inquiriesfor ringing group. This counter appears only if the sequential alerting feature is available and active.

kpi_info.title: SRISMSCFUATTEMPT
kpi_info.use: Number of received SRI_for_SMfor unconditional SMS forwarding in the HLR during the measurement period. This counter is updated when the user exists in the database and the SMS forwarding is active. In this case, the T21 basic service (MT SM) is not updated.

kpi_info.title: SRISMSCFUSUCCESSFUL
kpi_info.use: Number of successfully answered SRI_for_SMsfor unconditional SMS forwarding in the HLR during the measurement period. In this case, the T21 basic service (MT SM) is not updated. The successful SRI SMS-CFU update does not mean a successful SMS Forwarding event, because if the forwarded to number does not belong to the allowed (co-operation) PLMNs, then the forwarding is overridden. In this case the SMS is delivered to the forwarding subscriber (a normal SRI_for_SM procedure is executed).

kpi_info.title: HLR_PRIMARYMEMBERINTATTEMPT
kpi_info.use: Number of primary member interrogationattempts for ringing group.This counter appears only if the parallel alerting feature is available and active.

kpi_info.title: HLR_PRIMARYMEMBERINTSUCC
kpi_info.use: Number of successful primary member interrogationsfor ringing group. This counter appears only if the parallel alerting feature is available and active.

kpi_info.title: HLR_CALLDIVERTINTATTEMPT
kpi_info.use: Number of call divert interrogation attemptsfor ringing group. This counter appears only if the parallel alerting feature is available and active.

kpi_info.title: HLR_CALLDIVERTINTSUCCESSFUL
kpi_info.use: Number of successful call divert interrogationsfor ringing group. This counter appears only if the parallel alerting feature is available and active.

kpi_info.title: HLR_CALLHANDLING
kpi_info.use: Database transaction related to incoming call handling, such as fetching and updating the subscriber data. In mobile-terminating call, the counter is increased by one.

kpi_info.title: HLR_MOBILITYMANAGEMENT
kpi_info.use: Database transactions related to subscriber mobility. In a subscriber location update the counter is increased by one.

kpi_info.title: EPS_LOCATION_UPDATE_ATTEMPT
kpi_info.use: Number of requested Location Updates (Update Location Procedure on S6a interface) sent by MMEs during the measurement period. These events are not included in the former normal LU counters.

kpi_info.title: EPS_LOCATION_UPDATE_SUCCESS
kpi_info.use: Number of successful Location Updates (Update Location Procedure on S6a interface) responses sent to MMEs during the measurement period. These events are not included in the former normal LU counters.

kpi_info.title: EPS_SUBSCRIBER_COUNT
kpi_info.use: Number of subscribers having at least one EPS related PDP context defined in the HLR.
